titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Elizabeth Smith Miller Letter, 1860 June 13 RL.11462
titlestmt.author: Alice L. Poffinberger

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-05-04 10:45:48 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Elizabeth Smith Miller was an early advocate of suffrage for women. Collection comprises a letter Elizabeth Smith Miller wrote to Franklin Bachellor in order to return his lost stamp.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Elizabeth Smith Miller was an early advocate of suffrage for women. She resided in Peterboro, N.Y. She was the daughter of Gerrit Smith, an abolitionist and supporter of John Brown.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Elizabeth Smith Miller Letter was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2016.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Elizabeth Smith Miller Letter, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2016-0198

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection comprises a letter Elizabeth Smith Miller wrote to Franklin Bachellor in order to return his lost stamp.
